problem_context: In this question we will continue with the circuit from question 3. You will first be asked to estimate the area and speed of the circuit. Then in the second part you will be asked to design a parallel implementation and report the size of the circuit.

subproblem.subproblem_question: Calculate the size of the circuit in Question 3.
Calculate the critical path of the circuit in Question 3.

answer.solution:
tcrit old = tmux 8b + tmul 8b + taddsub 16b + tmux 16b + treg 16b

= 0.2ns + 2.5ns + 2.1ns + 0.2ns + 0ns(setup)

= 5.0ns

subproblem.subproblem_question: How long (in ns) will it take this circuit to complete one complex multiplication? Note: it will take more than one clock cycle

answer.solution: There are four cycles needed to complete the operation. Each cycle takes tcrit old = 5ns this means that a complex multiplication can be completed every told = 20ns.

subproblem.subproblem_question: It turns out that the circuit in Question 3, is too slow for your application. Draw the block diagram for an architecture that calculates the complex multiplication combinationally (i.e. within one clock cycle).
How much larger is this new circuit when compared to the previous circuit from Question 3?

answer.solution:
Anew = 4 × Amult 8bit + Aadder 16bit + Asubtracter 16bit

= 4 × 2, 100 + 600 + 600

= 9′600

The circuit is Anew/Aold = 9, 600/4, 000 = 2.4 times larger.

subproblem.subproblem_question: How much faster does this new circuit compute a complex multiplication when compared to the previous circuit from Question 3?

answer.solution:
tnew = tmult 8bit + tadder 16bit

= 2.5ns + 2.0ns

= 4.5ns

The circuit is told/tnew = 20/4.5 = 4.4 times faster.
